The provided chunk pertains to configuration variables in Panda3D related to vertex data handling, including alignment, compression, memory allocation, and thread management. These settings influence how vertex data is stored, compressed, and accessed, affecting both performance and memory usage.

**Context:** This section discusses global configuration options for managing vertex data in Panda3D. It covers vertex data alignment, compression levels, page size allocations, and the use of threads for efficient handling of vertex data pages in memory or on disk, impacting overall application performance and resource utilization.

controls this alignment for the vertex animation columns only. vertex-data-compression-level int 1 Specifies the zlib compression level to use when compressing vertex
data. The number should be in the range 1 to 9, where larger values are
slower but give better compression. vertex-data-page-size int 262144 The number of bytes to allocate at a time for vertex data. This also
controls the page size that is compressed or written to disk when vertex
data pages are evicted from memory. vertex-data-page-threads int 1 When this is nonzero (and Panda has been compiled with thread
